intro: Gilibertia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed sida, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with three distinct lobes, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
